ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: My Chinese ability exponentially improved by taking this class. I am now a much more fluent speaker and am able to recognize characters and understand the language much better.
I was able to take a deep dive into basic Chinese grammar while immersing myself in Chinese culture.
This class helped me improve my pronunciation, grammar, and fluency in Chinese. I also developed a deeper understanding of the language.

I improved my ability to speak, read, write, and listen to Chinese. I now know more vocabulary and grammatical structures and am more comfortable with writing essays and making presentations in Chinese.
I really felt that my speaking ability improved significantly throughout the semester as well as my reading comprehension.
I learned more Chinese vocabulary and grammar. My understanding of grammar definitely improved the most.
Improved my Chinese speaking ability and knowledge of common sentence structures.
I learned a large set of new vocabulary applicable to daily life, and I gained a lot of confidence in my Chinese ability, particularly speaking and listening.
I greatly improved my Chinese

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course is very rigorous, which means that if you do all of the work, you are guaranteed to improve/learn a lot. Sometimes, the workload was a little bit overwhelming, as there would occasionally be 3 assignments due each day.
This course is extremely well structured. The teachers make their expectations of students extremely clear. The course load can be heavy but the teachers are very supportive.
It is a bit frustrating that the class meets everyday but it has proven to be necessary in order to truly do well in the course. I also loved all of the group activities that we did.

Strengths: very organized, clear and quick feedback, high level of engagement, supportive and responsive professors, exams and homework not too difficult compared to some other courses. Weaknesses: one of the more difficult language courses at Yale, easy to fall behind in, requires a high level of engagement and participation in class (sometimes difficult if you are tired/sick).
I loved that the class time was spent talking only in Chinese and that Ao Laoshi asked us so many questions in order to have us engage with classmates.
I appreciated the very personalized feedback from TAs and my professor, Ao Laoshi. I have little feedback for improvementI enjoyed this course.
The strengths were the knowledge of the Professor and how interactive the course is. The weaknesses were that some sections of the textbook were not particularly useful.

The strengths of the course were that there was a lot of daily Chinese dialogue between students and the teacher as well as between classmates. This proactive learning made it much easier to absorb large amounts of new content.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would absolutely recommend this course to another student who is interested in gaining a deeper knowledge of the Chinese language.
I would recommend this class to anyone who is looking to drastically improve their Chinese speaking, listening and understanding skills.
Yes, it is such a great course and helped improve my Chinese so much.

Yes! The Chinese program at Yale is really great because of the supportive professors and organized structure. Class was typically very fun and you never feel blindsided by exams, projects, or grades. It is a lot of work though since it is a 1.5-credit course, so that might be something to factor in.

I would absolutely recommend this course to another student because, although the workload and class time is high, your speaking confidence and ability will greatly improve and Ao Laoshi was an incredible professor.
Yes, I would recommend this course to anyone looking to improve their Chinese. My professor was great, too!
Yes - the Chinese professors at Yale are excellent and my speaking abilities have improved a lot this semester as a result.
I would recommend this course because looking back, I am impressed by how much Chinese I learned and how much more confident I am.
Yes.  The teachers and students are excellent.
